channel.title: Jammu Kashmir on NewsStreet
channel.description: Recent content in Jammu Kashmir on NewsStreet

item.title: Show seriousness, commit to problems of masses: LG tells PDD
item.description: Show seriousness, commit to problems of masses: LG tells PDD Jammu Tawi, Nov 29: Chairing a review meeting of the Power Development Department (PDD) here Tuesday, Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha urged the PDD officers to reduce AT&C losses and strengthen the monitoring mechanism of power projects.

item.title: Traditional wickerwork on its last legs in Kashmir
item.description: Traditional wickerwork on its last legs in Kashmir Ganderbal, Nov: Wickerwork, a well-known art in Kashmir, is slowly fading away as many artisans associated with this industry are switching to other forms of livelihood.

item.title: Cold in J&K leads to decline in dengue cases
item.description: Cold in J&K leads to decline in dengue cases Srinagar, Nov 29 : With dip in the temperature in J&K, the dengue cases in J&K are on decline and just 12 fresh cases were reported on Tuesday in the UT.

item.title: Ist summary revision after delimitation concludes J&K registers an increase of 7.73 lakh new voters –up by 10 percent
item.description: Ist summary revision after delimitation concludes J&K registers an increase of 7.

item.title: Police recovers IED from mini-bus in Ramban
item.description: Police recovers IED from mini-bus in Ramban Ramban, Nov 25: The Jammu and Kashmir police on Friday claimed to have recovered and defused an Improvised Explosive Device planted in a mini-bus in Ramban district.

item.title: NIA files suppli chargesheet against J&K Resident
item.description: NIA files suppli chargesheet against J&K Resident Srinagar, Nov 25: The National Investigation Agency on Friday filed a supplementary chargesheet against a Jammu and Kashmir resident in a case related to criminal conspiracy of carrying put militant attacks at different places in Uttar Pradesh and other parts of the country.

item.title: Sgr records coldest night of season
item.description: Sgr records coldest night of season No wet spell till the end of Nov Srinagar, Nov 23 (KNO): As the weather is expected to remain dry for next ten days, the minimum temperature plummeted across the Valley while Srinagar, the summer capital of Jammu and Kashmir, recorded coldest night of the season at minus 0.

item.title: White paper on Waqf encroachments in April 2023: Darakshan
item.description: White paper on Waqf encroachments in April 2023: Darakshan Says preparing files to trap big fish involved in encroachments Srinagar, Nov 23: Waqf Board Chairperson, Darakshan Andrabi on Wednesday said the white paper about encroachments of Waqf property will be made public in April next year.

item.title: Financial powers of Panchayati Raj Institutions enhanced from 5 lakh to 1 Cr
item.description: Financial powers of Panchayati Raj Institutions enhanced from 5 lakh to 1 Cr Jammu Tawi, Nov 23: The Administrative Council (AC) which met here under the chairmanship of the Lieutenant Governor, Manoj Sinha, approved the delegation of powers for granting Administrative Approval to Gram Panchayats, Block Samitis and Zila Parishads for execution of works, the expenditure of which will be met out of Panchayats’ own resources.

item.title: People have rejected divisive politics in J&K: Bukhari
item.description: People have rejected divisive politics in J&K: Bukhari Jammu Tawi, Nov 23: Apni Party President Syed Mohammed Altaf Bukhari on Wednesday said people have rejected the divisive politics in Jammu and Kashmir which was responsible for seven decades of suffering.

item.title: MoS Edu reaches Ganderbal on 2-day visit
item.description: MoS Edu reaches Ganderbal on 2-day visit Ganderbal, Oct 25: Union Minister of State forEducation and External Affairs Dr.
